answers.answer: First off, congrats on your twins, you are so lucky!!  Try not to worry to much.  Naseau comes and goes, some women don't experience it at all.  Every women, and every pregnancy is different.  She is getting close to the end of first trimester, and its not uncommon for symptoms to start to calm down now.  And its not like they all disapperared, just this one.  If it puts your mind to rest, request another u/s.  But, after strong heartbeats have been detected, chances of miscarriage drop dramatically.  I am sure all is just fine!!Best wishes to you and your new little family, and congrats again.  I wish you well, and your surrogate a happy healthy pregnancy!

I completely agree with adgal. Congratulations by the way. If your gestational carrier has been able to get through MS after only three weeks I am jealous. That has to be the worst symptom of pregnancy and I could have done without it.Seems to me that all else is doing well. I wish you a healthy, happy eight more seven more months (if you make it that far having twins).
Thanks ladies,I can use all the encouragement I can get. It feels good to finally have a baby(ies) on the way. I jsut don't want anything to happen.

Regarding having nausea...when I was pregnant I bought the wrist bands for nausea, they worked great and kept the feeling of nausea at bay for me...I think I bought them at Target for about 8 dollars.

Nausea comes and goes...as a matter of fact Im 23 wks and feeling nauseated today.  But I will say that it went away around 13 wks or so for me and this is the first time Ive felt this way since.  Preggo Pops help...I found them at Babys R Us. And buy that book...'what to expect when you are expecting' it will REALLY put you at ease about your babies. :-) CONGRATS!

I was one of the weird ones with NO nausea AT ALL. I never felt bad once during my whole preg but I was tired a lot. I actually had someone tell me that it was a bad sign that I felt so good, that it meant the preg wouldn't last!! I was worried and I went to my Dr and she said I was one of the lucky few!! She said It was Bull crud that I was SUPPOSED to feel sick and as a matter of fact, she was the mother of twins she carried and she said other than being VERY tired, she never threw up! She said she remembered feeling not so hot a few times, but never "got sick". Don't worry, besides, if she isn't sick, she can eat more which is better for the babies than an empty tummy.

Nausea is a symptom of HIGH BLOOD SUGAR.  And that's about the time she got diagnosed as having gestational diabetes.She feels hungry probably because her blood sugar is too high and she needs insulin.

the test for gestational diabetes is not done till way into the 2nd almost to the 3rd trimester, it is not done in the first trimester, google hyperglycemia, EXCESSIVE THIRSTcarissa:every pregnancy is different ,congrats on  your twins, I too am expecting twin girls, due in 23 days, I had nausea all the way up to 18 weeks, but it was all different times of the day, and certain things would set it off, I say at this point you got 2 good heart beats. good luck and keep us posted

cowriter-Thanks for the info-yes, that is around the time GD started. She is now on medication for it, so I'm hoping it is finally under control.babyprayers-thanks for the reassurance! Congratulations on your twins. How exciting. It still doesn't feel real to me. My gc did get GD early in her pregnancy. I know it's not normal, but it happened! It's been a roller coaster already. I can't wait until it is all over and they are here!!

question: Hi ladies,My gestational carrier (surrogate) is 9wks1day pregnant with my twins. She had nausea from week 6 through amost to week 9, but never actually got sick. Staring a couple of days ago she stopped feeling sick, but is still tired and extremely hungry. She had an ultraound at 8wks2days and everything looked great. Both babies were measuring on target and both had a good heartrate, 172&176bpm. I'm worried that she has miscarried either one or both of the babies. Is it every normal for nausea to end around the 9th week? ThanksCarisa
title: question about nausea?
